sentences: Jack Leon Gordon (November 10, 1939 – April 19, 2005), also known as Samuel Isaac Gordon and Clifford William Johnson, was an American businessman and entertainment manager.
section: N/A

sentences: Gordon was most known as the former manager and later husband of American singer–songwriter La Toya Jackson.
section: N/A

sentences: In addition to being Jackson's manager, Gordon later served as the manager of American tabloid subject later turned porn actor John Wayne Bobbitt.
section: N/A

sentences: Gordon died of cancer on April 19, 2005 at age 65.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: Early life and criminal allegations ===
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: Jack Leon Gordon was born in Springfield, Illinois to Abraham Gordon, a Jewish Russian immigrant and Faye Stein, an Illinois native of Jewish heritage.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: While some sources cite Gordon's birthplace as Springfield, Illinois, he claimed Las Vegas was his birthplace when he changed his name in 1981 to Samuel Isaac Gordon.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: However, in 1983, when he changed his name again, this time to Clifford William Johnson, he said that he was born in Springfield.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: In the 1970s, Gordon ran arcades at Circus Circus in Las Vegas.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: He later bought controlling interest in a Los Angeles massage parlor called Circus Maximus in West Hollywood.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: Gordon subsequently bought two additional massage parlors, one in Signal Hill and the other in Costa Mesa, California.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===

sentences: In 1984, a conviction for pandering in Los Angeles resulted in three months probation.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and criminal allegations ===
== Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid =
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===
== Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===
== Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: In 1978, Gordon offered $12,000 to then-chairman of the Nevada Gaming Commission Harry Reid to approve two new, carnival-like gaming devices (Flip-A-Winna and Penny Falls) for casino use.
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: Gordon believed the games would bring him more than $100 million in profits.
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: Reid notified the FBI and allowed agents to videotape a meeting with Gordon in his office.
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: At the point where Reid asked, "Is this the money?", FBI agents burst in to arrest Gordon.
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: Reid, a former boxer, exclaimed "You son of a bitch, you tried to bribe me!" and attempted to strangle Gordon, before startled agents pulled him off.
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: Gordon was convicted in federal court in 1979 and sentenced to six months in prison.
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===

sentences: In 1981, Reid's wife found a bomb attached to one of their cars, a bomb Reid suspects was placed by Gordon.
section: == Life and career == | === Bribe offer to Gaming Commission chairman Harry Reid ===
== Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: In the mid-1980s, Gordon began to manage La Toya Jackson along with her father Joseph, but he took over her management completely during the late 1980s.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: He married her in Reno, Nevada on September 5, 1989, claiming that it was for her own protection against kidnapping by the Jackson family.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: La Toya Jackson stated that this was both unplanned and against her wishes.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: La Toya said: "I told him, 'No way, Jack!
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: I can't marry you.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: You know what marriage means to me.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: I've never been in love; I don't even date....
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: It's not right.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: I don't love you.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: I don't have feelings for you.'"
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Jackson stated that she tried to run out of the chapel three times but bodyguard Antonio Rossi grabbed her saying, "There's some things you have to do.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Even if you don't want to."
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Jackson told Ebony magazine the marriage was "strictly in name only.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: It has never been consummated."
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Six months into the marriage, Jackson asked Gordon for an annulment in Italy.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: In response, she claims that Gordon repeatedly bashed her head against the side of a table, saying that he would never let her go.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Paparazzi subsequently photographed Jackson with black eyes, which Gordon claimed was caused by intruders.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: From this point forward, Jackson lost all contact with her family and wrote her autobiography La Toya: Growing up in the Jackson Family, which accused her father of child abuse.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Gordon sometimes hired bodyguards to watch La Toya and she claimed that he would never allow her to speak to or see her family.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: La Toya's father Joseph stated in his book The Jacksons that he believed Gordon brainwashed her and made her scared of her own family.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Jackson's mother Katherine also agreed that La Toya had been brainwashed while Gordon claimed that Katherine had tried to kill La Toya.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Her sister Janet concurred with her parents saying at the time, "I think this guy who is with her has brainwashed her and made her like this...
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: He keeps her away from the family, and now he's brainwashed her so much she keeps herself away from us."
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: In 1993, in their New York home, Gordon allegedly beat La Toya repeatedly with a heavy brass dining room chair, leaving Jackson with bruises on her face, arms, legs and back in addition to a black eye, lip and chin swollen to "the size of a clenched fist," requiring 12 stitches in her mouth.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Jackson told reporters, "he kicked me in the mouth (and) the boot went right up under my lip . . .
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: all the way through the skin and burst my lip."
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Jackson supposedly lost consciousness during the beating, leading Gordon to believe she was dead.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: She recalled: "He called his friends and said, 'She's dead.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: I killed her,' because I was lying in a puddle of blood and I was out."
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Gordon was arrested but then released, claiming self-defense after La Toya "came at" him with a knife.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: He then declared to the press that he was undergoing radiation treatments for cancer.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: In December 1993, Gordon hastily arranged a press conference in Tel Aviv where he had Jackson read a statement that she believed sex abuse allegations against her younger brother Michael were true.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: She stated, "I cannot and will not be a silent collaborator in his crimes against young children...
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Forget about the superstar, forget about the icon.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: If he was any other 35-year-old man who was sleeping with little boys, you wouldn't like this guy".
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Gordon claimed La Toya had proof which she was prepared to disclose for a fee of $500,000.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: A bidding war between US and UK tabloids began, but fell through when they realized that her revelations were not what she had claimed them to be.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: According to La Toya, Gordon threatened to have siblings Michael and Janet killed if she didn't follow his orders.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Under Gordon's management, Jackson's career declined, as he booked her disreputable jobs such as spokesperson for the Psychic Friends Network.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Due to Gordon's steady stream of publicity stunts Jackson had become a hate figure of sorts.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: In 1996, Gordon attempted to force Jackson to dance at a Reading PA strip club.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: She refused to do so and in return, was booed and heckled by the predominantly male crowd.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: When Jackson became aware that Gordon was planning to feature her in a pornographic film, she decided that she had enough.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Jackson phoned her brother Randy, who flew to New York City to help her escape while Gordon was out.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===

sentences: Days later, La Toya filed for divorce.
section: == Life and career == | === Management and marriage to La Toya Jackson ===
== Life and career == | ==== Accusations about the Jackson family ====

sentences: Accusations about the Jackson family =
section: == Life and career == | ==== Accusations about the Jackson family ====
== Life and career == | ==== Accusations about the Jackson family ====

sentences: While La Toya was in seclusion for four years, Gordon continued to make accusations about the Jackson family.
section: == Life and career == | ==== Accusations about the Jackson family ====

sentences: He claimed that La Toya's younger brother Michael had performed monkey sacrifice rituals, abused Bubbles the chimpanzee, and even accused him of forcing Lisa Marie Presley to marry him.
section: == Life and career == | ==== Accusations about the Jackson family ====

sentences: In 2002, Gordon did interviews advertising his tell-all book of the Jackson family entitled The Jackson Family: The True Story Of The Most Powerful Family In The Music Industry.
section: == Life and career == | ==== Accusations about the Jackson family ====

sentences: The entire family, including his former wife, stated that his allegations were "pure fantasy."
section: == Life and career == | ==== Accusations about the Jackson family ====
== Life and career == | === Mafia associations ===

sentences: Mafia associations ===
section: == Life and career == | === Mafia associations ===

sentences: FBI wiretaps in 1994 linked Gordon to Genovese crime family member James "Little Jimmy" Ida.
section: == Life and career == | === Mafia associations ===

sentences: Gordon was taped arranging for mobsters to shadow Jackson on a trip to Russia.
section: == Life and career == | === Mafia associations ===

sentences: Gordon paid the group $1,500 a month for at least two years to protect La Toya from "shakedowns" by rival mobsters.
section: == Life and career == | === Mafia associations ===

sentences: Gordon also employed the services of organized crime defense attorney and former Las Vegas mayor Oscar Goodman.
section: == Life and career == | === Mafia associations ===
== Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: Other entertainment clients ===
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: Jack Gordon had few other entertainment clients apart from La Toya Jackson.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: Before Gordon became La Toya's co-manager with her father in the late 1980s (and eventually manager)
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: it was widely known he had a disreputable past including trouble with the law.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: Joseph Jackson was always afraid of Gordon as he believed Gordon was probably armed.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: Gordon's clients included John Wayne Bobbitt, Divine Brown, Gloria Gaynor, Shannen Doherty, and Sharon Stone.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: In 1999, Gordon claimed that Paula Jones, a pivotal figure in the impeachment trial of Bill Clinton, had confided in him that Clinton had not sexually harassed her as she originally claimed.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: Gordon arranged Jones' nude spread in Penthouse, and claimed he helped her launch a psychic hotline.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: However, in a March, 1999 CNN Politics website article, Susan Carpenter McMillan, a confidante and former adviser to Jones, issued a statement from Jones that she had not, nor would she ever do anything with a psychic hotline.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===

sentences: McMillan also has stated that Gordon was "obsessed" with the former Arkansas state employee, phoning her up to 15 times a day.
section: == Life and career == | === Other entertainment clients ===
